text:
Two Regular Joes Get Ripped By Trying Chris Evan's Captain America Workout © Buzzfeed Blue Two Regular Joes Get Ripped By Trying Chris Evan's Captain America Workout Two Average Joes Tried The Captain America Workout And The Results Are Insane 0 Shares 
Getting in shape can be a real daunting task. Where to even begin? Especially if you're a little clueless as to what to do when you finally get your behind through the doors of your local gym, getting the results can be a real challenge. 
Buzzfeed challenged two average joes (a dude and a girl) two aim high — and we're talking about Chris Evan's Captain America and Scarlett Johansson's Black Widow ripped. 
Here's what Evan and Kelsey looked like before their transformation: 
What Chris Evan's personal trainer Steve Zim immediately noticed was bad posture, but also the fact that both of them had a great starting point — something definitely to keep in mind when judging the "after" pictures. 
With the help of amino acid and melatonin supplements, they hit the gym. And they hit it hard. 
Trainer Steve got them to not only do rough days of isolated exercises focusing on areas like the glutes and shoulders (in Evan's case), he subjected them to a specific nutritional plan as well. No cheese in salads, and a ton of protein from sources like In-N-Out burger patties and a million Greek yoghurts. The Results 
Both of them immediately noticed the results. Not only did they have an easier time getting out of bed, they noticed their muscles looked more toned in pictures, and even started enjoying their time at the gym. 
Kelsey shredded nine pounds of body weight, and was down over 6% body fat. 
Evan gained four and a half inches in his shoulders, and slimmed over an inch in the waist. Body fat percentage went down over 6% as well. His abs become more pronounced. Is this really achievable? 
The first thing that should be noted is the fact that both of them were in a pretty good place. An excellent starting point will give you a huge leg up if you're in for a transformation in just 30 days. 
What this experiment also showed was the fact that slimming down and getting toned is about hitting the gym, but also paying a lot of attention to what you put into your body. 
So overall, it's impressive how far both Evan and Kelsey got in just thirty days. But focusing on things like shoulder width and bicep circumference don't necessarily tell the whole story. But in essence, it goes to show that both hard work at the gym and a very focused diet can get you pretty far in just 30 days — depending on your starting-off point of course. Show comments
